Your card of Sep. 25th was duly received. Mr. Benjamin Sulte
Benjamin Sulte (1841-1923) war ein kanadischer Journalist, Schriftsteller und Historiker. is an employee in one of the Canadian Goverment [sic] Bureaus, at Ottawa. He knows nothing about language, except as a general historian. He is considered one of the best young historians in Canada and is a great producer in that Department. His articleGemeint ist vermutlich der folgende Artikel Sultes:
Sulte, Benjamin. 1877. ‘Notre Langue‘. In Revue de Montréal I:657-668 ., to which you refer, is wholly unscientific and superficial. I have just begun to publish the preliminary parts of my work on Canada, Gemeint wird vielleicht der folgende Artikel:
Elliott, A[aron] M[arshall]. 1885. ‘Contributions to a History of the French Language of Canada‘. In American Journal of Philology VI, 2: 135-150.
which I shall send you as soon as they appear. I have spent a part of my summer in the maritime provinces (Cape Breton, Isle Madame & Nova Scotia) of Canada, and have collected a large amount of supplementary material on the French Acadian languages, which I propose to use in my work.
I was in Germany in July and expected fully to see you, but was detained at EmsGemeint wird Bad Ems. longer than I had thought to be when I left home. I hope next summer to be able to see you somewhere over there.

closer.salute: Hoping you are very well, I am, as ever,
